greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1) = 1; a(2n) = -a(n); a(2n+1) = -a(n) + a(n+1).
link: J.P. Allouche and M. Mendes France, Stern-Brocot polynomials and power series, arXiv preprint arXiv:1202.0211 [math.NT], 2012. - From _N. J. A. Sloane_, May 10 2012
formula: Let M = an infinite lower triangular matrix with (1, -1, -1, 0, 0, 0,...) in every column, shifted down twice for columns k >1. Then the sequence is the left-shifted vector of Lim_{n->inf} M^n.
G.f.: x*Product_{k>=0} (1 - x^(2^k) - x^(2^(k + 1))). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Aug 30 2017
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, May 04 2010
